00037 #include <linux/fs.h>
00038 #include <linux/sched.h>
00039 #include <linux/mm.h>
00040 #include <linux/xattr.h>
00041 #include <linux/selinux.h>
00042 
00043 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LLITE
00044 
00045 #include <obd_support.h>

00051 
00052 /* xattr related to IMA(Integrity Measurement Architecture) */
00053 #ifndef XATTR_NAME_IMA
00054 #define XATTR_NAME_IMA          "security.ima"
00055 #endif
00056 #ifndef XATTR_NAME_EVM
00057 #define XATTR_NAME_EVM          "security.evm"
00058 #endif
00059 
00060 #define XATTR_USER_T            (1)
00061 #define XATTR_TRUSTED_T         (2)
00062 #define XATTR_SECURITY_T        (3)
00063 #define XATTR_ACL_ACCESS_T      (4)
00064 #define XATTR_ACL_DEFAULT_T     (5)
00065 #define XATTR_LUSTRE_T          (6)
00066 #define XATTR_OTHER_T           (7)
00067 
00068 static
00069 int get_xattr_type(const char *name)
00070 {
00071         if (!strcmp(name, POSIX_ACL_XATTR_ACCESS))
00072                 return XATTR_ACL_ACCESS_T;
00073 
00074         if (!strcmp(name, POSIX_ACL_XATTR_DEFAULT))
00075                 return XATTR_ACL_DEFAULT_T;
00076 
00077         if (!strncmp(name, XATTR_USER_PREFIX,
00078                      sizeof(XATTR_USER_PREFIX) - 1))
00079                 return XATTR_USER_T;
00080 
00081         if (!strncmp(name, XATTR_TRUSTED_PREFIX,
00082                      sizeof(XATTR_TRUSTED_PREFIX) - 1))
00083                 return XATTR_TRUSTED_T;
00084 
00085         if (!strncmp(name, XATTR_SECURITY_PREFIX,
00086                      sizeof(XATTR_SECURITY_PREFIX) - 1))
00087                 return XATTR_SECURITY_T;
00088 
00089         if (!strncmp(name, XATTR_LUSTRE_PREFIX,
00090                      sizeof(XATTR_LUSTRE_PREFIX) - 1))
00091                 return XATTR_LUSTRE_T;
00092 
00093         return XATTR_OTHER_T;
00094 }
00095 
00096 static
00097 int xattr_type_filter(struct ll_sb_info *sbi, int xattr_type)
00098 {
00099         if ((xattr_type == XATTR_ACL_ACCESS_T ||
00100              xattr_type == XATTR_ACL_DEFAULT_T) &&
00101            !(sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_ACL))
00102                 return -EOPNOTSUPP;
00103 
00104         if (xattr_type == XATTR_USER_T && !(sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_USER_XATTR))
00105                 return -EOPNOTSUPP;
00106         if (xattr_type == XATTR_TRUSTED_T && !cfs_capable(CFS_CAP_SYS_ADMIN))
00107                 return -EPERM;
00108         if (xattr_type == XATTR_OTHER_T)
00109                 return -EOPNOTSUPP;
00110 
00111         return 0;
00112 }
00113 
00114 static
00115 int ll_setxattr_common(struct inode *inode, const char *name,
00116                        const void *value, size_t size,
00117                        int flags, __u64 valid)
00118 {
00119         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(inode);
00120         struct ptlrpc_request *req = NULL;
00121         int xattr_type, rc;
00122         posix_acl_xattr_header *new_value = NULL;
00123         struct rmtacl_ctl_entry *rce = NULL;
00124         ext_acl_xattr_header *acl = NULL;
00125         const char *pv = value;
00126         ENTRY;
00127 
00128         /*FIXME: enable IMA when the conditions are ready */
00129         if (strncmp(name, XATTR_NAME_IMA,
00130                     sizeof(XATTR_NAME_IMA)) == 0 ||
00131             strncmp(name, XATTR_NAME_EVM,
00132                     sizeof(XATTR_NAME_EVM)) == 0)
00133                 return -EOPNOTSUPP;
00134 
00135         xattr_type = get_xattr_type(name);
00136         rc = xattr_type_filter(sbi, xattr_type);
00137         if (rc)
00138                 RETURN(rc);
00139 
00140         if ((xattr_type == XATTR_ACL_ACCESS_T ||
00141              xattr_type == XATTR_ACL_DEFAULT_T) &&
00142 #ifdef HAVE_INODE_OWNER_OR_CAPABLE
00143             !inode_owner_or_capable(inode))
00144 #else
00145             !is_owner_or_cap(inode))
00146 #endif
00147                 return -EPERM;
00148 
00149         /* b10667: ignore lustre special xattr for now */
00150         if (strcmp(name, XATTR_NAME_HSM) == 0 ||
00151                 (xattr_type == XATTR_TRUSTED_T &&
00152                 strcmp(name, XATTR_NAME_LOV) == 0) ||
00153                 (xattr_type == XATTR_LUSTRE_T &&
00154                  strcmp(name, "lustre.lov") == 0))
00155                 RETURN(0);
00156 
00157         /* b15587: ignore security.capability xattr for now */
00158         if ((xattr_type == XATTR_SECURITY_T &&
00159             strcmp(name, "security.capability") == 0))
00160                 RETURN(0);
00161 
00162         /* LU-549:  Disable security.selinux when selinux is disabled */
00163         if (xattr_type == XATTR_SECURITY_T && !selinux_is_enabled() &&
00164             strcmp(name, "security.selinux") == 0)
00165                 RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);
00166 
00167 #ifdef CONFIG_FS_POSIX_ACL
00168         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_RMT_CLIENT &&
00169             (xattr_type == XATTR_ACL_ACCESS_T ||
00170             xattr_type == XATTR_ACL_DEFAULT_T)) {
00171                 rce = rct_search(&sbi->ll_rct, current_pid());
00172                 if (rce == NULL ||
00173                     (rce->rce_ops != RMT_LSETFACL &&
00174                     rce->rce_ops != RMT_RSETFACL))
00175                         RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);
00176 
00177                 if (rce->rce_ops == RMT_LSETFACL) {
00178                         struct eacl_entry *ee;
00179 
00180                         ee = et_search_del(&sbi->ll_et, current_pid(),
00181                                            ll_inode2fid(inode), xattr_type);
00182                         LASSERT(ee != NULL);
00183                         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLXATTR) {
00184                                 acl = lustre_acl_xattr_merge2ext(
00185                                                 (posix_acl_xattr_header *)value,
00186                                                 size, ee->ee_acl);
00187                                 if (IS_ERR(acl)) {
00188                                         ee_free(ee);
00189                                         RETURN(PTR_ERR(acl));
00190                                 }
00191                                 size =  CFS_ACL_XATTR_SIZE(\
00192                                                 le32_to_cpu(acl->a_count), \
00193                                                 ext_acl_xattr);
00194                                 pv = (const char *)acl;
00195                         }
00196                         ee_free(ee);
00197                 } else if (rce->rce_ops == RMT_RSETFACL) {
00198                         int acl_size = lustre_posix_acl_xattr_filter(
00199                                                 (posix_acl_xattr_header *)value,
00200                                                 size, &new_value);
00201                         if (unlikely(acl_size < 0))
00202                                 RETURN(acl_size);
00203                         size = acl_size;
00204 
00205                         pv = (const char *)new_value;
00206                 } else
00207                         RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);
00208 
00209                 valid |= rce_ops2valid(rce->rce_ops);
00210         }
00211 #endif
00212         rc = md_setxattr(sbi->ll_md_exp, ll_inode2fid(inode), valid, name, pv,
00213                          size, 0, flags, ll_i2suppgid(inode), &req);
00214 
00215 #ifdef CONFIG_FS_POSIX_ACL
00216         if (new_value != NULL)
00217                 lustre_posix_acl_xattr_free(new_value, size);
00218         if (acl != NULL)
00219                 lustre_ext_acl_xattr_free(acl);
00220 #endif
00221         if (rc) {
00222                 if (rc == -EOPNOTSUPP && xattr_type == XATTR_USER_T) {
00223                         LCONSOLE_INFO("Disabling user_xattr feature because "
00224                                       "it is not supported on the server\n");
00225                         sbi->ll_flags &= ~LL_SBI_USER_XATTR;
00226                 }
00227                 RETURN(rc);
00228         }
00229 
00230         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00231         RETURN(0);
00232 }
00233 
00234 static int get_hsm_state(struct inode *inode, __u32 *hus_states)
00235 {
00236         struct md_op_data *op_data;
00237         struct hsm_user_state *hus;
00238         int rc;
00239 
00240         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(hus);
00241         if (hus == NULL)
00242                 return -ENOMEM;
00243 
00244         op_data = ll_prep_md_op_data(NULL, inode, NULL, NULL, 0, 0,
00245                                      LUSTRE_OPC_ANY, hus);
00246         if (!IS_ERR(op_data)) {
00247                 rc = obd_iocontrol(LL_IOC_HSM_STATE_GET, ll_i2mdexp(inode),
00248                                    sizeof(*op_data), op_data, NULL);
00249                 if (rc == 0)
00250                         *hus_states = hus->hus_states;
00251                 else
00252                         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "obd_iocontrol failed. rc = %d\n",
00253                                rc);
00254 
00255                 ll_finish_md_op_data(op_data);
00256         } else {
00257                 rc = PTR_ERR(op_data);
00258                 CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "Could not prepare the opdata. rc = %d\n",
00259                        rc);
00260         }
00261         OBD_FREE_PTR(hus);
00262         return rc;
00263 }
00264 
00265 int ll_setxattr(struct dentry *dentry, const char *name,
00266                 const void *value, size_t size, int flags)
00267 {
00268         struct inode *inode = dentry->d_inode;
00269 
00270         LASSERT(inode);
00271         LASSERT(name);
00272 
00273         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:inode="DFID"(%p), xattr %s\n",
00274                PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)), inode, name);
00275 
00276         ll_stats_ops_tally(ll_i2sbi(inode), LPROC_LL_SETXATTR, 1);
00277 
00278         if ((strncmp(name, XATTR_TRUSTED_PREFIX,
00279                      sizeof(XATTR_TRUSTED_PREFIX) - 1) == 0 &&
00280              strcmp(name + sizeof(XATTR_TRUSTED_PREFIX) - 1, "lov") == 0) ||
00281             (strncmp(name, XATTR_LUSTRE_PREFIX,
00282                      sizeof(XATTR_LUSTRE_PREFIX) - 1) == 0 &&
00283              strcmp(name + sizeof(XATTR_LUSTRE_PREFIX) - 1, "lov") == 0)) {
00284                 struct lov_user_md *lump = (struct lov_user_md *)value;
00285                 int rc = 0;
00286 
00287                 /* Attributes that are saved via getxattr will always have
00288                  * the stripe_offset as 0.  Instead, the MDS should be
00289                  * allowed to pick the starting OST index.   b=17846 */
00290                 if (lump != NULL && lump->lmm_stripe_offset == 0)
00291                         lump->lmm_stripe_offset = -1;
00292                 /* Avoid anyone directly setting the RELEASED flag. */
00293                 if (lump != NULL &&
00294                         (lump->lmm_pattern & LOV_PATTERN_F_RELEASED)) {
00295                         /* Only if we have a released flag check if the file
00296                         * was indeed archived. */
00297                         __u32 state = HS_NONE;
00298                         rc = get_hsm_state(inode, &state);
00299                         if (rc != 0)
00300                                 RETURN(rc);
00301                         if (!(state & HS_ARCHIVED)) {
00302                                 CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE,
00303                                         "hus_states state = %x, pattern = %x\n",
00304                                         state, lump->lmm_pattern);
00305                                 /* Here the state is: real file is not
00306                                  * archived but user is requesting to set
00307                                  * the RELEASED flag so we mask off the
00308                                  * released flag from the request */
00309                                 lump->lmm_pattern ^= LOV_PATTERN_F_RELEASED;
00310                         }
00311                 }
00312 
00313                 if (lump != NULL && S_ISREG(inode->i_mode)) {
00314                         struct file     f;
00315                         __u64           it_flags = FMODE_WRITE;
00316                         int             lum_size;
00317 
00318                         lum_size = ll_lov_user_md_size(lump);
00319                         if (lum_size < 0 || size < lum_size)
00320                                 return 0; /* b=10667: ignore error */
00321 
00322                         memset(&f, 0, sizeof(f)); /* f.f_flags is used below */
00323                         f.f_path.dentry = dentry;
00324                         rc = ll_lov_setstripe_ea_info(inode, &f, it_flags, lump,
00325                                                       lum_size);
00326                         /* b=10667: rc always be 0 here for now */
00327                         rc = 0;
00328                 } else if (S_ISDIR(inode->i_mode)) {
00329                         rc = ll_dir_setstripe(inode, lump, 0);
00330                 }
00331 
00332                 return rc;
00333 
00334         } else if (strcmp(name, XATTR_NAME_LMA) == 0 ||
00335                    strcmp(name, XATTR_NAME_LINK) == 0)
00336                 return 0;
00337 
00338         return ll_setxattr_common(inode, name, value, size, flags,
00339                                   OBD_MD_FLXATTR);
00340 }
00341 
00342 int ll_removexattr(struct dentry *dentry, const char *name)
00343 {
00344         struct inode *inode = dentry->d_inode;
00345 
00346         LASSERT(inode);
00347         LASSERT(name);
00348 
00349         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:inode="DFID"(%p), xattr %s\n",
00350                PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)), inode, name);
00351 
00352         ll_stats_ops_tally(ll_i2sbi(inode), LPROC_LL_REMOVEXATTR, 1);
00353         return ll_setxattr_common(inode, name, NULL, 0, 0,
00354                                   OBD_MD_FLXATTRRM);
00355 }
00356 
00357 int ll_getxattr_common(struct inode *inode, const char *name,
00358                        void *buffer, size_t size, __u64 valid)
00359 {
00360         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(inode);
00361         struct ptlrpc_request *req = NULL;
00362         struct mdt_body *body;
00363         int xattr_type, rc;
00364         void *xdata;
00365         struct rmtacl_ctl_entry *rce = NULL;
00366         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(inode);
00367         ENTRY;
00368 
00369         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:inode="DFID"(%p)\n",
00370                PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)), inode);
00371 
00372         /* listxattr have slightly different behavior from of ext3:
00373          * without 'user_xattr' ext3 will list all xattr names but
00374          * filtered out "^user..*"; we list them all for simplicity.
00375          */
00376         if (!name) {
00377                 xattr_type = XATTR_OTHER_T;
00378                 goto do_getxattr;
00379         }
00380 
00381         xattr_type = get_xattr_type(name);
00382         rc = xattr_type_filter(sbi, xattr_type);
00383         if (rc)
00384                 RETURN(rc);
00385 
00386         /* b15587: ignore security.capability xattr for now */
00387         if ((xattr_type == XATTR_SECURITY_T &&
00388             strcmp(name, "security.capability") == 0))
00389                 RETURN(-ENODATA);
00390 
00391         /* LU-549:  Disable security.selinux when selinux is disabled */
00392         if (xattr_type == XATTR_SECURITY_T && !selinux_is_enabled() &&
00393             strcmp(name, "security.selinux") == 0)
00394                 RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);
00395 
00396 #ifdef CONFIG_FS_POSIX_ACL
00397         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_RMT_CLIENT &&
00398             (xattr_type == XATTR_ACL_ACCESS_T ||
00399             xattr_type == XATTR_ACL_DEFAULT_T)) {
00400                 rce = rct_search(&sbi->ll_rct, current_pid());
00401                 if (rce == NULL ||
00402                     (rce->rce_ops != RMT_LSETFACL &&
00403                     rce->rce_ops != RMT_LGETFACL &&
00404                     rce->rce_ops != RMT_RSETFACL &&
00405                     rce->rce_ops != RMT_RGETFACL))
00406                         RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);
00407         }
00408 
00409         /* posix acl is under protection of LOOKUP lock. when calling to this,
00410          * we just have path resolution to the target inode, so we have great
00411          * chance that cached ACL is uptodate.
00412          */
00413         if (xattr_type == XATTR_ACL_ACCESS_T &&
00414             !(sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_RMT_CLIENT)) {
00415 
00416                 struct posix_acl *acl;
00417 
00418                 spin_lock(&lli->lli_lock);
00419                 acl = posix_acl_dup(lli->lli_posix_acl);
00420                 spin_unlock(&lli->lli_lock);
00421 
00422                 if (!acl)
00423                         RETURN(-ENODATA);
00424 
00425                 rc = posix_acl_to_xattr(&init_user_ns, acl, buffer, size);
00426                 posix_acl_release(acl);
00427                 RETURN(rc);
00428         }
00429         if (xattr_type == XATTR_ACL_DEFAULT_T && !S_ISDIR(inode->i_mode))
00430                 RETURN(-ENODATA);
00431 #endif
00432 
00433 do_getxattr:
00434         if (sbi->ll_xattr_cache_enabled &&
00435             xattr_type != XATTR_ACL_ACCESS_T &&
00436             (xattr_type != XATTR_SECURITY_T ||
00437                 strcmp(name, "security.selinux") != 0)) {
00438                 rc = ll_xattr_cache_get(inode, name, buffer, size, valid);
00439                 if (rc == -EAGAIN)
00440                         goto getxattr_nocache;
00441                 if (rc < 0)
00442                         GOTO(out_xattr, rc);
00443 
00444                 /* Add "system.posix_acl_access" to the list */
00445                 if (lli->lli_posix_acl != NULL && valid & OBD_MD_FLXATTRLS) {
00446                         if (size == 0) {
00447                                 rc += sizeof(XATTR_NAME_ACL_ACCESS);
00448                         } else if (size - rc >= sizeof(XATTR_NAME_ACL_ACCESS)) {
00449                                 memcpy(buffer + rc, XATTR_NAME_ACL_ACCESS,
00450                                        sizeof(XATTR_NAME_ACL_ACCESS));
00451                                 rc += sizeof(XATTR_NAME_ACL_ACCESS);
00452                         } else {
00453                                 GOTO(out_xattr, rc = -ERANGE);
00454                         }
00455                 }
00456         } else {
00457 getxattr_nocache:
00458                 rc = md_getxattr(sbi->ll_md_exp, ll_inode2fid(inode),
00459                                 valid | (rce ? rce_ops2valid(rce->rce_ops) : 0),
00460                                 name, NULL, 0, size, 0, &req);
00461 
00462                 if (rc < 0)
00463                         GOTO(out_xattr, rc);
00464 
00465                 body = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MDT_BODY);
00466                 LASSERT(body);
00467 
00468                 /* only detect the xattr size */
00469                 if (size == 0)
00470                         GOTO(out, rc = body->mbo_eadatasize);
00471 
00472                 if (size < body->mbo_eadatasize) {
00473                         CERROR("server bug: replied size %u > %u\n",
00474                                 body->mbo_eadatasize, (int)size);
00475                         GOTO(out, rc = -ERANGE);
00476                 }
00477 
00478                 if (body->mbo_eadatasize == 0)
00479                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENODATA);
00480 
00481                 /* do not need swab xattr data */
00482                 xdata = req_capsule_server_sized_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_EADATA,
00483                                                         body->mbo_eadatasize);
00484                 if (!xdata)
00485                         GOTO(out, rc = -EFAULT);
00486 
00487                 memcpy(buffer, xdata, body->mbo_eadatasize);
00488                 rc = body->mbo_eadatasize;
00489         }
00490 
00491 #ifdef CONFIG_FS_POSIX_ACL
00492         if (rce != NULL && rce->rce_ops == RMT_LSETFACL) {
00493                 ext_acl_xattr_header *acl;
00494 
00495                 acl = lustre_posix_acl_xattr_2ext(buffer, rc);
00496                 if (IS_ERR(acl))
00497                         GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(acl));
00498 
00499                 rc = ee_add(&sbi->ll_et, current_pid(), ll_inode2fid(inode),
00500                             xattr_type, acl);
00501                 if (unlikely(rc < 0)) {
00502                         lustre_ext_acl_xattr_free(acl);
00503                         GOTO(out, rc);
00504                 }
00505         }
00506 #endif
00507         EXIT;
00508 
00509 out_xattr:
00510         if (rc == -EOPNOTSUPP && xattr_type == XATTR_USER_T) {
00511                 LCONSOLE_INFO("%s: disabling user_xattr feature because "
00512                                 "it is not supported on the server: rc = %d\n",
00513                                 ll_get_fsname(inode->i_sb, NULL, 0), rc);
00514                 sbi->ll_flags &= ~LL_SBI_USER_XATTR;
00515         }
00516 out:
00517         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00518         return rc;
00519 }
00520 
00521 static ssize_t ll_getxattr_lov(struct inode *inode, void *buf, size_t buf_size)
00522 {
00523         ssize_t rc;
00524 
00525         if (S_ISREG(inode->i_mode)) {
00526                 struct cl_object *obj = ll_i2info(inode)->lli_clob;
00527                 struct lu_env *env;
00528                 struct cl_layout cl = {
00529                         .cl_buf.lb_buf = buf,
00530                         .cl_buf.lb_len = buf_size,
00531                 };
00532                 __u16 refcheck;
00533 
00534                 if (obj == NULL)
00535                         RETURN(-ENODATA);
00536 
00537                 env = cl_env_get(&refcheck);
00538                 if (IS_ERR(env))
00539                         RETURN(PTR_ERR(env));
00540 
00541                 rc = cl_object_layout_get(env, obj, &cl);
00542                 if (rc < 0)
00543                         GOTO(out_env, rc);
00544 
00545                 if (cl.cl_size == 0)
00546                         GOTO(out_env, rc = -ENODATA);
00547 
00548                 rc = cl.cl_size;
00549 
00550                 if (buf_size == 0)
00551                         GOTO(out_env, rc);
00552 
00553                 LASSERT(buf != NULL && rc <= buf_size);
00554 
00555                 /* Do not return layout gen for getxattr() since
00556                  * otherwise it would confuse tar --xattr by
00557                  * recognizing layout gen as stripe offset when the
00558                  * file is restored. See LU-2809. */
00559                 ((struct lov_mds_md *)buf)->lmm_layout_gen = 0;
00560 out_env:
00561                 cl_env_put(env, &refcheck);
00562 
00563                 RETURN(rc);
00564         } else if (S_ISDIR(inode->i_mode)) {
00565                 struct lov_mds_md *lmm = NULL;
00566                 int lmm_size = 0;
00567                 struct ptlrpc_request *req = NULL;
00568 
00569                 rc = ll_dir_getstripe(inode, (void **)&lmm, &lmm_size,
00570                                       &req, 0);
00571                 if (rc < 0)
00572                         GOTO(out_req, rc);
00573 
00574                 if (buf_size == 0)
00575                         GOTO(out_req, rc = lmm_size);
00576 
00577                 if (buf_size < lmm_size)
00578                         GOTO(out_req, rc = -ERANGE);
00579 
00580                 memcpy(buf, lmm, lmm_size);
00581                 GOTO(out_req, rc = lmm_size);
00582 out_req:
00583                 if (req != NULL)
00584                         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00585 
00586                 return rc;
00587         } else {
00588                 RETURN(-ENODATA);
00589         }
00590 }
00591 
00592 ssize_t ll_getxattr(struct dentry *dentry, const char *name, void *buf,
00593                     size_t buf_size)
00594 {
00595         struct inode *inode = dentry->d_inode;
00596 
00597         LASSERT(inode);
00598         LASSERT(name);
00599 
00600         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:inode="DFID"(%p), xattr %s\n",
00601                PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)), inode, name);
00602 
00603         ll_stats_ops_tally(ll_i2sbi(inode), LPROC_LL_GETXATTR, 1);
00604 
00605         if (strcmp(name, XATTR_LUSTRE_LOV) == 0 ||
00606             strcmp(name, XATTR_NAME_LOV) == 0)
00607                 return ll_getxattr_lov(inode, buf, buf_size);
00608         else
00609                 return ll_getxattr_common(inode, name, buf, buf_size,
00610                                           OBD_MD_FLXATTR);
00611 }
00612 
00613 ssize_t ll_listxattr(struct dentry *dentry, char *buf, size_t buf_size)
00614 {
00615         struct inode *inode = dentry->d_inode;
00616         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(inode);
00617         char *xattr_name;
00618         ssize_t rc, rc2;
00619         size_t len, rem;
00620 
00621         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:inode="DFID"(%p)\n",
00622                PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)), inode);
00623 
00624         ll_stats_ops_tally(ll_i2sbi(inode), LPROC_LL_LISTXATTR, 1);
00625 
00626         rc = ll_getxattr_common(inode, NULL, buf, buf_size, OBD_MD_FLXATTRLS);
00627         if (rc < 0)
00628                 RETURN(rc);
00629 
00630         /* If we're being called to get the size of the xattr list
00631          * (buf_size == 0) then just assume that a lustre.lov xattr
00632          * exists. */
00633         if (buf_size == 0)
00634                 RETURN(rc + sizeof(XATTR_LUSTRE_LOV));
00635 
00636         xattr_name = buf;
00637         rem = rc;
00638 
00639         while (rem > 0) {
00640                 len = strnlen(xattr_name, rem - 1) + 1;
00641                 rem -= len;
00642                 if (xattr_type_filter(sbi, get_xattr_type(xattr_name)) == 0) {
00643                         /* Skip OK xattr type, leave it in buffer. */
00644                         xattr_name += len;
00645                         continue;
00646                 }
00647 
00648                 /* Move up remaining xattrs in buffer removing the
00649                  * xattr that is not OK. */
00650                 memmove(xattr_name, xattr_name + len, rem);
00651                 rc -= len;
00652         }
00653 
00654         rc2 = ll_getxattr_lov(inode, NULL, 0);
00655         if (rc2 == -ENODATA)
00656                 RETURN(rc);
00657 
00658         if (rc2 < 0)
00659                 RETURN(rc2);
00660 
00661         if (buf_size < rc + sizeof(XATTR_LUSTRE_LOV))
00662                 RETURN(-ERANGE);
00663 
00664         memcpy(buf + rc, XATTR_LUSTRE_LOV, sizeof(XATTR_LUSTRE_LOV));
00665 
00666         RETURN(rc + sizeof(XATTR_LUSTRE_LOV));
00667 }
